p: Plants have always been serving as an essential originator of drugs and lead compounds. A lot of potential drugs have been developed from the traditional history of medicinal plants. However, some of those plants may contain a wide range of chemical constituents, often with undetermined biological properties [ 53]. Therefore, the identification of active constituents in a plant can be initiated through phytochemical screening. In the current study, the qualitative phytochemical screening of MEBJ manifested the existence of carbohydrates, cholesterol, proteins, flavonoids, alkaloids, phenols, saponins, tannins, and fatty acids (data not shown).
